CatDescriptText: Gerald Brown, Hays Manor, McKees Rocks, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 15, 1958, pg. 2 �Do you think that the numbers game should be legalized or outlawed?� answer reads: �I think that the numbers racket should be outlawed in every way. There should be a law passed to keep people from playing them because they could use the money for other things which would give them greater benefit.  Also, the odds are so great against the player anyhow.�
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Gerald Brown wearing dark plaid button down coat with wide lapels, and light colored hat with dark band, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, May Building with Thrift Drugs in background, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
